reviews.text: Absolutely lovely place to grab food and drinks. The library is a semi private space to enjoy your meal and relax. Went with my little sister after her grad and we enjoyed tapas, drinks, dinner, and watched some MTV classics 😂. Our bartend ladies were amazing 😍

This is the best hotel in DC!  impeccable service and such an amazing professional staff! Thank you,Jefferson team for setting such a high standard of excellence!  All of the touches you implement are noticed and appreciated.  Our entire family loves this hotel and has many fond memories here throughout many decades now!

I had a gift card and decided to use it to take a friend to lunch.  I had checked the balance about a week ahead.  After ordering, I had the waitress check it again, and was told it was no longer good.  Embarrassing!
David Bueno, General Manager, "saved the day".  He honored the gift card.  We will definitely return.

TOP TIER.
Exemplary service.
I took one of my students to experience the Jefferson level of service so that she may understand what and how to deliver similar experiences when interacting with her own clientele.

In a world of quick service, I'm so glad to see the attention to detail remains at Jefferson.
Best bar in DC. Quiet, professional, romantic. Amazing martinis and ask for the pickled vegetables that come on the side. So glad this place exists. You won’t be disappointed

Excellent! The front desk staff, valet, and housekeepers were all extremely friendly and accommodating. My wife, dog and I recently stayed 4 nights and had a great time. Hotel was Very clean, spacious and modern. The balcony room is a must have in my opinion and it didn’t disappoint. The area is really nice and has plenty of walkable spots for food, coffee, etc. Firefly has an eclectic brunch menu and they have great bar tenders as well. The only negative I could possibly share would be the water pressure but with multiple settings for the shower it was fine. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to have an amazing guest experience with a high standard for cleanliness in the nation’s capital.

The minute we walked in the staff’s energy was amazing - we were able to check in very early and upgrade to a larger room which was so comfortable for the 3 of us. I’m in real estate and my friends live in beautiful homes so I had to get the hotel right and I did! this space was stylish, sleek and well equipped.. The robes warmed us nicely along with the electric pot to make our coffee and tea. Just lovely we will certainly let come back and stay at Madera. the restaurant had a delicious brunch we enjoyed as well- this made our DC weekend wonderful

My son and I really enjoyed our stay here, everyone is so sweet . The hotel is absolutely beautiful and it has a very nice restaurant on premises.  I really have to give a big shout out to the manager  Maggie  is the most sweetest person ever. She made me feel so special and important.  Please please keep her, I will definitely come back to visit. Thank you so much for an amazing experience.  I highly recommend.

The location is amazing, near restaurants, cafes, Subway and the neighborhood is beautiful. The rooms are very comfortable, large and the balconies are great.  The restaurant on the first floor has great breakfast and the staff is by far the nicest I have ever experience besides my recent stay in at the intercontinental in Cali Colombia. Kudos to the amazing staff they do a fantastic job. Especial thanks to ICE at the front desk.  When we go back to DC we will stay @ hotel Madeira for sure.

I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Madera. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was very clean. I stayed in the King Studio with balcony and the room was very spacious. The room included a large sectional couch and it was very comfy. I also enjoyed the shower because it was very roomy and also had a handheld shower head sprayer. The water in the shower got very hot easily. The room also included a tea kettle to heat water for hot beverages.

Checked in. Very nice. Got up to our hotel room. Apparently the fridge is not a fridge. Just a cooler now. They've stopped using as a fridge. None of the Keurig or the kettle were plugged in. We plugged it in. Room is nice. Very spacious. Bed is nice and big.  TV has lots of channels to watch TV. If you're in your hotel room for long enough, lots of on demand movies that cost you about $20 a piece, but that's okay

Nice renovated property with amenities including gym, sauna, jacuzzi and swimming pool. The rooms are modern and spacious, corridors and lift halls clean and well maintained.
The lobby is spacious, well lit with plenty of seating space. Staff at front desk was courteous and helpful. Lobby bar and Courtyard bar staff was also friendly and knowledgeable about activities within the hotel vicinity.
Hotel is within walking distance to White House and short ride to mall and other monuments. Public transports and taxis are available on the doorstep. Street parking is also available in addition to plenty of parking garages.
Breakfast buffet could have more variety.
Overall, a very pleasant experience.

We were underwhelmed.  We attended the Christmas Day brunch and stayed overnight for Christmas.  The brunch service was excellent and the staff were extremely attentive and accommodating.  The food was OK, but we did not expect much more for a buffet.
The room, however, was disappointing.  The air quality was poor and the thermostat could not be set to adjust the temperature in the room.  We woke congested and unable to breathe; there was also a rank odor in the room that smelled like a wet dog🥺  We called and asked for a manager but no one ever called back.  We complained at check out, but little was done about the matter.  The front desk seemed indifferent.  None of the soaps in the bathroom had been replenished in the shower.  We expected a bit more for a 4 star hotel.  Not sure we would stay again…as locals, we love to explore hotels and provide details of our journeys.  We would stick to the Four Seasons Georgetown as our top recommendation, as this was more of a 2/3 star experience.

Nice property, good venue for a conference. Rooms are very nice and the staff is friendly and attentive. My only knock is the wifi network is pretty bad. It was difficult to participate in Teams calls. Everything else was great - especially if you need to be in the Georgetown area.

Pathetic staff and Managers. There were so many issues since we arrive at this hotel but we ignored them and checked out. They charged us twice for the same stay. We reached out to the hotel with all details to refund the amount they charged without our authorization on August 24, 2022, and followed up several times via email. No one has come back to us yet. I am posting this review in hope that they will reach out to me and process a refund. It's been more than 15 days now.

Headed to Old Ebbitt during the spring for the second time in my life and boy was excited to be back. Sat at the bar this time for a late lunch and some drinks. Bartender was super friendly to us as tourists, helpful with the drink and food menu suggestions, and very attentive. Made everyone at the bar feel like regulars striking up conversations with everyone.

The drinks were well made and the food was delicious. The overall atmosphere makes you think of all the people who have visited the bar since its existence. Really close to several attractions and easy to walk or bike to.  I look forward to visiting for dinner next time I’m in town.

There are straightforward American-style food. This restaurant is best known for its huge old-school oyster bar—think lots of dark wood, brass fixtures, and big mirrors. That oysters was fantastic and fresh.  We’ve  enjoyed also cheese sampler, fried calamari and baked oysters. Everything they do is absolutely delicious. The service was very fast and friendly. We were happy to choose this great restaurant to end our busy day in Washington, D.C.

Loved the experience! Tasted a dozen oysters and each one was more delicious than the other.
Wine is very fairly priced. Saw it more expensive in some New York wine discount stores.
The fish was such a huge portion when they split it in two plates we told them that we did not order 2 plates but to our surprise that was a full plate.
If you get a chance to go to happy hours for oysters don't hesitate!

Make Reservation!
This place is a must when in DC.
Freshest seafood , the flavors are so delightful. The preparation is pretty quick, fresh and delicious. The plate sizes are very filling. Service is unexpectedly good , considering how busy and packed the place is.
Check out the happy hours - particularly for the deal on oysters.

So glad we got desserts even though we were so stuffed with the main course alone.

Had an awesome time here as a late night/ early next day stop. The food was quite nice and fairly refined, especially at such a late hour! The atmosphere was popping as well which made it more enjoyable. Service was very friendly and they had great oysters. Fresh complimentary bread never hurts either…

This was my first time at the Dupon Circle location and I went for the White Truffle Menu Fine Dining Experience.  The food was Hella yummy (the shroom burger is the best!) And the service was extra awesome! There was a "fine dining" white linen tablecloth Experience to roll out the white truffle menu. It was fantastic and I'm extremely glad that I went! Go there. The food is yummy and the people are great

Tried my old favorite for the first time in more than 10 years. It was crowded with young people and the wait was relatively long. The patty was a bit burnt and less juicy than it used be. It used to be that with each bite into the burger, flavor of meat spread throughout the mouth. But this time around it was less satisfying.

I came two days ago and them burgers were hitting so good & the workers were so nice and patient. I just seen them other reviews like no this is a 5 star experience I had, like how can milkshake even be melted? Yes I’m throwing shade. These workers need a raise idc!! They working their a$$ off !!!!
Not your typical fast food resturant.  It's definitely a step above that.  Food was good and fresh to order.  Kinda expensive but that seems to be how things are nowadays.
It is always busy at this location. My order takes about 25 minutes. The shroom burger is good.

We had a fabulous experience here. It's a very fun atmosphere and the food was delicious. I had the crazy corn chicken salad and it might be my most favorite salad ever. My husband had the southwest chicken salad and my daughter had the chicken and waffles. Everyone enjoyed their meal. Our waitress, Camilla, was fantastic and has a great personality. Everyone working there seemed like they were having a good time.

Quality food and drinks!  Stopped by while out and about visiting DC with the family.  Short walk from several metro stations.  Reserved a table during lunchtime the morning we went and was seated minutes after we showed up.  Staff was attentive and my drink was never empty.  Reasonable prices for the quality food you get considering the location and love the bar menu.  Was recommended this place by several people and it was quickly apparent why.  Will definitely visit again next time we are in DC!

Really fresh, delicious breakfast! We tried the waffle, pancake, and egg scramble. Obviously made in house - really delicious. Pancakes and waffles were exceptional. Egg scramble was very savory. The coffee is way better than your average breakfast place. Service was quick and friendly. Recommended!

What a gem! The food, the ambiance and the service were all phenomenal. The food quality was fresh and extremely flavorful. We ordered a portion of their homemade biscuits and mimosas to start off. My husband then ordered brioche French Toast, which was to die for! I ordered their eggs Benedict with a side of fruit. The food was so good that we returned for dinner the same day.

Went here for dinner. Ordered their Glazed Cedar Plank Salmon, "Our Best Veggie Burger", Mac n' Cheese with chicken and Butterscotch Bread Pudding. To wash it down, I also got the Victory Golden Monkey. Everything was beautiful. The salmon was perfectly done and so were the mashed potatoes that accompanied it. The fries with the burger were fresh and so was the pasta. The pudding was rich and tasted awesome!

Will come back here again for sure.

Decided to come here for my birthday. Was super excited based on the reviews. Honestly,  all I can say is that it was okay. The atmosphere is absolutely stunning. The private dining option is amazing.  I wasn't pleased with the hostesses, which honestly drives my overall rating. Our server, while nice, just lacked something for me. The food was okay, nothing to scream about. I did enjoy the sushi roll I got, and my daughter enjoyed her lobster roll with a gluten-free free bread option, which was nice. I asked our server about validating our parking ticket, and she said the hostess could do that. When I got to the hostess stand, the girl rudely said they don't validate that parking garage ticket. I just felt after leaving, there was nothing all that special.

One of the best steaks I've had for a very long time. Very prompt seating even when busy. Very quick and polite service and delicious drinks. Even with special requests, they were very accommodating. Loved the inside design and lighting as every area was unique and colorful with the perfect amount of lighting. Can't wait to go back.

Hamilton, a restaurant located in Washington D.C., is a fantastic dining experience for anyone looking for delicious food and a great atmosphere. The restaurant is named after Alexander Hamilton, one of the founding fathers of the United States, and the decor reflects this theme with portraits of historical figures and vintage maps on the walls.

The menu at Hamilton offers a diverse range of dishes that are sure to please any palate. The seafood is particularly notable, with dishes like the crab cakes and seared scallops being favorites among diners. Additionally, the restaurant offers a selection of meat dishes such as the dry-aged steak and the lamb chops. The menu changes seasonally, so it's always a great idea to check the menu before going.

The service at Hamilton is top-notch, with the waitstaff being friendly and attentive. They are knowledgeable about the menu and can make great recommendations for diners who may be unsure of what to order.

The restaurant also has a great wine list, with a variety of options to complement the food. And they also offer a great selection of cocktails and beers.

One thing to keep in mind is that Hamilton can be a bit pricey, so it's best to save it for a special occasion. And also, it's a popular spot, so it's always a good idea to make a reservation in advance.

Overall, Hamilton is a fantastic restaurant that offers delicious food, great service, and a great atmosphere. It's a perfect spot for a special occasion, a date night, or a casual dinner with friends and family.

We made reservations at 6pm and were sat down right away upon arrival. Food was delicious and all came out quick! The Mac and cheese was a little cold but other than that, all of the dishes were 5/5.  On top of the fast service, our server Courtney was super nice and knowledgeable of everything on the menu. Loved our server and the food! Highly recommend as a dinner spot for friends and family!

We celebrated my bday here last night and it felt like we were dinning in back in time. The decor was very dramatic and vibe was a mix of chill and a good time. Performances are available in the basement( tickets sold separately) if you prefer to dine in with live music. If not, the dinning room upstairs is for you. The establishment is clean, the staff were welcoming and even though it was a bit busy, our food still came out in a timely manner. Food was tasty and we really enjoyed our time. They do have sushi happy hour from 2-5 Monday to Friday. I’m going to try that next! Also list of shows are also available on the left side of the menu.

Absolutely
Loved it the veggie
Omelette was delicious the toast and wedges 😋, the drinks were great according to my girls. My OJ was just fine and the waffles was nice. Check my girl out she had big fun.

This is a good spot to have a drink at the bar or grab a table and have a meal and drink. Tvs all over show different games. ID is checked to enter. Wings are bland. Turkey burger is seasoned well. Service is quick and helpful especially on Thursday night, they were not crowded at all.
Not my wife's and I's scene, but a cool place with great food and drinks. If we were 20 years younger we'd go back
Brunch music and food were good, parking was tricky, but had a nice time. Bottomless mimosas a plus!

I went on a Saturday night, which was my first time there.  As usual I was by myself and the security was cool.  I walked inside and felt this is not the place for me.  Decent music, but every table was "reserved" and there was a lot of hookah.

I am a guy who likes to dance and don't think this place really caters to the  dancing types?  And that is ok, as I take this establishment is mostly a place to eat or enjoy a happy hour?

Looking for information on the dancing?  Are tables moved later in the night?  Any information would be great, as no one mentions the dancing part of this club in any reviews.  Other than that, don't think I will be back.

My chicken bento box was really good. The sushi rolls was more like 4/5 stars for me (it could be just that little bit fresher IMO even though there’s nothing wrong with the quality). The service was excellent. If it was just $5 - 7 less per pax for the meal, the value would have been excellent. I am rating it 5 stars even though 4.5 stars is what I would have rated.

Good sushi, true to traditional style. Grilled octopus was also excellent
Had to order uni separately because it was not included in any set menu

The service here was absolutely perfect. They were all so kind and even put a candle on the dessert for my friend's birthday. And the food is delicious!! Lots of options, including vegetarian rolls. We enjoyed our visit here.

The restaurant was super accommodating in moving reservations when I called that same day. Ordered the special clam miso soup, seaweed salad (could be shared between 2 people), sashimi moriawase, and a spicy tuna roll. The host was aware it was my brother’s birthday and even sent over a beautiful, complimentary green tiramisu sponge! A delicious, super satisfying meal with a beautiful ambiance that would be great for dining in! All waiters were in masks and tables were distanced enough from each other. Highly recommend!
Great quality, recommend the KAZ Tasting 0011 & just keep the experience going until you're done.   Service is pretty slow, at least when we were there but we got what we came for in the end.

Went here for one of my many birthday dinners. As a new vegetarian this place definitely had a menu with me in mind. I was stuffed when I left. We had the menu with five courses and enjoyed every single one of them. Amazing. Would definitely go again, don’t know the price because i didn’t pay.  😇

Overall it was a great dining experience. The restaurant wasn't overly loud and it had an intimate vibe. We felt secluded enough in our table. The service was a bit slow to start, we waited over 20 min just to get our drink orders in. But then it picked up and we got our 5 course sampler and it was great. Some of the best food I've had.

We came for restaurant week and it was a great deal! Loved the plant based options. We had to wait 15 min for our table after we arrived on time for our reservation but it was worth it once we were seated. The mushroom dish was delicious and the portions for all courses were huge. Definitely ended the meal full and satisfied.

This place has been on my must try restaurants list forever, and finally made it on my birthday. We tried the five course meal. While each dish was carefully thought through and well presented, I think the beet salad didn’t really work (it was bitter) and grilled eggplant was a bit bland. Though I don’t typically enjoy mushrooms as much, I was blown by the Hen of mushrooms dish, and absolute winner. Overall, I would recommend this place!

I was there for a celebration and had a wonderful time and a wonderful meal. My appetizer was shrimp & grits. The main course was a filet. Desert was a yummy molasses cake with ice cream. It was all so delicious!!

Had a wonderful Mother's Day dinner here. A party of 8, we were seated in the back by the kitchen. Ambiance was vibrant, music selection was great throughout the night and our server was very attentive.

Got the fried snapper fish, came with a full body fried fish! Skin was crispy and flavorful, and the meat was tender. Rice and side salad came with the dish, provided good balance. My partner tried the Carolina Gumbo, to her liking!

Will definitely return for date night or just a nice random dinner outing. Enjoy!

Food is delicious! I had the lamb chops. They had a lot of fat on them which I didn’t really like but it was seasoned well. I also had the fried green tomatoes, a wonderful appetizer if you’re vegan. The cornbread was also a hit! I took some to go 😊. The drinks were pricey but strong. The best thing was the service!! Friendly and helpful staff that always checked on our large party.

This may be one of the funnest times I've ever had dinning out while out of town! The restaurant is beautiful and they've done a great job of decorations. The menu is an interesting and varied offering based on Southern soul food and New Orleans cuisine. I was able to join a large group of people and the restaurant was able to accommodate us wonderfully. The live music was also fantastic. I highly recommend the chicken fried steak!

A Sunday Brunch & Exquisite!  Place was absolutely beautiful & chic! The courses for the meal was just divine! Reservations recommended! The hustle & bustle of the city matches our beauty inside of the Black Diaspora! The food , from beginning to end , was nothing short of AMAZING! LOVE !  Staff was attentive, warm & inviting ! The house band played... We did not want leave! Celebrate our soul food traditions with just a different depth! Grits, biscuits, salad & my fave... Fried green tomatoes! I highly recommend! Prepare for an experience!

A fun atmosphere but overall wasn't worth the cost. For $200, my partner and I split the fried green tomato appetizer, each had a main - devil's shrimp for me and fried snapper for him - and shared the pecan pie and peach cobbler. The food was fine, tasty but not the tastiest, unique, or elevated. And for $35-50 per main, I expected more.

We stayed over Christmas 2022, for the first of, no doubt many, visits. Every inch of this boutique hotel has been planned and decorated with creativity and style. But be warned that some conveniences, like elevators and in-room TVs are missing. There are cool paintings and sculptures throughout the hotel and navigating the narrow hallways is a fun activity onto itself.  Our room was similarly artful and very clean, though some features of the bathroom reflected the age of the building. We didn't get to try the highly rated restaurant (closed when we arrived), but there is a great restaurant/bar literally across the street. Highly recommend this gem, specially for those that are willing to trade a bit of convenience for a huge payback in style.

The restaurant here is amazing! I travel a lot, and always want to go to unique places. This hit every mark I was looking for. When I go to new places I try to find good food and good atmosphere. Usually my searches only have one of these qualities. It is a good thing that this was the last place I went to in D.C. because I would have kept coming back, and not got to explore. I highly recommend.

Love this location! The room we stayed in was modest but quite pleasant and filled with wooden furniture. It had everything we needed. The still water bottle that was in the room with the two glasses was much appreciated. The bathroom was new, perfectly maintained, and clean. We were so preoccupied looking at the pictures on the walls, furniture and conversing that we didn't even notice that there was no TV.  We didn't have time for breakfast, despite the fact that they gave us a $10 cupoon to use. An excellent one-night visit to Washington, DC. We'll be back.

Lovely experience here. Staff are friendly and helpful. Being a historic building, expect some creaky floors and a lack of some modern conveniences you might expect from other downtown hotels. But the rooms are quite spacious and decorated in a fun, quirky way.
I haven't stayed at the hotel but went for drinks after work. Lovely cozy atmosphere, wonderful server, and the wine and cheese board were delicious. Also enjoyed the live music.

Overall I thought it was good. Had the pot pie, French onion soup, and the Mac and cheese. I say the food is good because if it were to have a touch of garlic powder, a hint of rosemary, or some fresh cracked pepper, it would shift to great. It was by no stretch of the imagination bad, it was good with small room for improvement. I’ll still be back.

The service was great. The waitress was very attentive. The manager came to the table and asked how things were. To me that is perfection. It shows they are committed to the customer experience. I really appreciated that.

The dress code was casual. It was nice to see people just there relaxing and having a good time.

I will certainly be back.

We arrived at opening and were only customers until closer to noon. The staff are the best. One at our party even reached out about a job opportunity to a waitress.

I ordered the duct confit croquettes. Very good and perfect size. Another ordered the Apple Parker House Rolls. I believe this may be the best bread I have ever eaten.

Others ordered French Onion and Kale Salad. She enjoyed both. Another had the Cuban. I went with Halibut Sandwich. The fish was cooked perfectly.

If in DC again I would go back.

This was my second time dining at Lincoln. I love the ambience and overall look of the restaurant. Service was attentive and courteous. I ordered the macaroni and cheese and French onion soup as starters and the pan roasted salmon as my entree. The macaroni and cheese is amazing, as it was the last time I was there. The French onion soup also delicious. I was a little disappointed in my salmon. I am a lover of salmon and order it as often as I can, but I found the salmon and accompanying brussels sprouts to be lacking seasoning. Overall, I would dine here again, and I look forward to my next time.
Such a great eatery spot, the food, service and atmosphere was amazing. I would have liked our mimosas to be stronger but it was tasty. The devil eggs and fried green tomatoes were my absolute fave.

I was pleasantly surprised by this outstanding dining experience. So happy to have found this gem.  The food and menu surpassed our expectations.  We had to come back later for to go desserts.  The restaurant decor is so interesting, amazing artwork, and fascinating murals of pennies.  The staff was great.  I highly recommend a visit and I look forward to my return.

I really liked the restaurant and its vibe. The service was great and fast. Our waitress, she was amazing. Drinks were tasty and interesting. We didn’t like the Brussel sprout at all so we didn’t touch it, and we didn’t say anything. However our waitress realized it and she was kind enough to suggest and change it for us. We got the caesar salad instead which was amazing!! For main course we ordered the dry aged bon in steak 18 oz to share. it was really tasty and good. However part of my steak was burnt ( we ordered medium, which was really good medium) but not sure why part of was burnt! Also since we wanted to share they cut it for us in advance and put their full butter on Top for each of us which was too much butter for half steak. At the end i wish it wasn’t burnt on outside (part of it) and i wish was less buttery. Still tasty though. Not to mention the lava cake was good too.
Note 1. I didn’t know my plate is too hot so I touched it to move it and burned my finger! I wish they told me it was hot.
Note 2. If you rely on google map to find it remember it is inside the building on the second floor. So don’t walk around wondering.

If you're on a budget, this isn't the place for you.  Online menus haven't been updated since before COVID and the reasonably priced lunch specials are no longer available.   I was so disappointed because both the Crispy Chicken BLT and Prime Burger looked so good.

Made a reservation and arrived 30 mins early. We were promptly seated with no issues and greeted by Jerry, whom is probably the most professional waiter I've ever had! He gave honest suggestions and we ended up with the filet mignon and wagyu filet with brussel sprouts and sour cream mashed potatoes. Drinks were on point! Highly recommend the lemon drop martini and old fashioned, you can't go wrong! I thank you for the outstanding service, you will see us again!

Very average dining experience. Food was okay. Ambiance was good. Service was good. Nothing spectacular, but good. Parking wasn't easy to find, but we finally realized that there was a parking lot across the street. Also it's on the second floor of the business building, not very visible from the outside.

WOW. I feel spoiled. Thank you. Enjoyed every bite. As it should be. We had a great time. Oysters, two different salads, crab cakes, waygu steak.  Perfectly prepared.
Robin the manager was very accommodating and welcoming.
Special place for a special time or just anytime.

The best meal since Decmber and believe me I have been to.many restaurants since. The spicy food is so skillfully made that you taste the various spices individually as well as a whole. The decor is understated elegance and service was impeccable. Coming back soon!

First I want to start by giving a shoutout to Heather, she is amazing! I called to make a dinner reservation for a party of 6. She was so accommodating and really helpful getting us a table at the time we wanted. Some changes to our plan occurred that made me reduce our reservation to 4 people, but I had to bump it back to 6 a couple days later. Although it was a busy night and they were fairly booked out, Heather took the extra step to ensure our party of 6 would be included and we wouldn't have to change times or dates. She is truly the best! My experience with her alone made my overall review a 4/5. Food was closer to 3/5 stars.

For drinks I got the mango lassi which tasted fresh and was very satisfying. For starters we got the dahi puri chaat, crispy kale and crab kori. Out of the 3 the crispy kale was delicious and so unique. Definitely a must for first timers at Bombay Club!

For entrees we split the following: Lamb vindaloo, chicken biryani, chicken makhni, halibut, garlic naan, goat cheese kulcha, mint paratha, and truffle naan. I honestly didn't feel any of the main dishes stood out to me. The halibut was unique and something different, but the lamb vindaloo tasted normal, chicken biryani and chicken makhni were ok, and the different naans and parathas were also normal. Nothing significant or good enough to make me go back.

Service was great. We had an amazing waiter who gave good recommendations and was very attentive the whole night. He convinced us to order the crispy kale as a starter and he did not let us down.

We had a visit to Washington DC and looking for an Indian restaurant for Lunch. While searching in google found this place. It was an amazing experience and served with delicious food. We ordered for Samudran Thali , it had different fish and vegetarian items. They also gave Roti along with Thali , we all enjoy, when I come next time definitely visit this place

Loved the appetizers - my favorites being the Murgh Malai Kabab and the Lal Maas. Tried the Mirchi G&T cocktail and that was a hit. The entrees were a bit of a let down though - especially the chicken dum biryani and the Chili Chicken. Ambience and the service were 5 stars.

If your likes Rasika (about a mile away from this place) then you’ll surely like this place. I liked the ambiance a little more than Rasika, we had someone playing the piano the day we visited. Foods great and staff is super friendly.

name: Café du Parc
vicinity: at Willard InterContinental, 1401 Pennsylvania Avenue Northwest, Washington

reviews.text: Great experience. Good setting with good food. Service was good and we were able to enjoy our food. The steaks were perfectly cooked and the fries that went with them were also great. On top off that it was reasonably priced which was great. The sorbet portions were very generous indeed.

Cafe du Parc is in the Willard Hotel. First of all, the hotel and restaurant were breath-taking!  Everything was beautifully decorated for the holidays! We ordered a Cobb salad, Willard burger, and even a side of ratatouille, which was as delicious as the movie says! Service was excellent and the atmosphere was very relaxing! Sorry, no food pics, but would highly recommend for a spectacular lunch!

The cutest little French pastry shop!  Delicious coffee!  Right next to the White House and across from the WWI memorial. After seeing all the memorials and important buildings this is the perfect spot to take a break and enjoy elegant desserts!
The peach pastry I ate was amazing and the coffee superb!

Was walking from downtown, to the monuments on a Saturday afternoon. No place was open for coffee, but we came across this boujie little spot.

They have a great selection of coffee and pastries, but you are going to be paying a lot. $18 for 2 lattes. Not worth the price, but DC prices.

Favorite part was sitting outside on the steps and doing some good ole fashion people watching.

I’d go here if you don’t care to break the bank and want to people watch as you sip your coffee.

Great breakfast!  We loved the eggs Benedict and avocado toast. We also liked dinner. We tried the salmon, which was okay, but nothing special, and the baked chicken breast, which was delicious and came with amazing mashed potatoes.

Visited on Sunday around 6pm. Surprisingly not busy at all! Great atmosphere with holiday decorations for meeting friends and having a conversation (we stopped by another place that had terribly loud music and was crowded.

Food we ordered was very good. I would rate it 5. Only minus, wished to have more choices  and desserts. But it was a great basic menu and everything tested great. Service was perfect. Quick and nice. Staff came regularly to ask whether we needed anything else.

Chill old school bar near the white house... Great selection of beers, and the bar food was decent. The barman was very chill and kept checking up on me quite a bit. The crowd was pretty respectful as well. They had soccer playing on the big screen behind the bar, which is rare but nice!

Really great burgers, salads, wraps and sandwiches at a reasonable price.
They have an awesome collection of beers as well.
Highly recommend a visit.

Ordered a "best voted cheeseburger" and good lord was it ever bland. Have they heard of seasoning? The service was good they acknowledged that we didn't eat the food, and did nothing about it. Chicken was dry. Don't do it.

Another fantastic DC underground dive. The bartenders are the real treat here. Charisma all around from Chuck and the gang. Long bar - space for everyone. Friendly locals. Good burgers. Jukebox. I would absolutely come back. Definitely worthy to be one of Eaters top 15 most lovable DC dives. I’ll be recommending it to anyone I know headed to DC.

One of the best (and priciest) places to grab lunch in Foggy Bottom. The sandwiches are pre-made but fresh and delicious. Soup and salad options are really. Fast and friendly service. I will be returning often!

Very friendly people serving up very delicious food! Great spot to get a smoothie, sandwich,
salad or pastry. Very close to George Washington University and the Foggy Bottom train station.
There was a wide variety of soups and you could taste a sample before deciding. The staff are really friendly.

I had a simple breakfast. Cheese eggs and potatoes. The eggs were a bit runny but was okay. Potatoes were good. I'm giving 5 stars because of the staff. All were super friendly. And it seems they take pride in their work. Even the person just sticking the waters, cokes, etc made sure all were faced the same way and in perfect order. Watching the bakers, it looked like they were taking care when prepping. Give them a try!

Great deli for grab and go! Everything was so fresh. The size of each sandwich is larger than usual, you definitely get your money worth it. The set up was very clean, roomy and organize. Love this place!

Extraordinary!!  and I do not exaggerate what I say.  the dough is absolutely perfect, the ingredients fresh and top quality.  The spotless place very clean and the staff very attentive and cheerful.  It opens until 2am which is very convenient for those of us who arrive late at the hotel.

Pretty decent pizza! Especially if you order by the slice and have them stick it back in the oven for a little extra time so the cheese gets melty. Stopped in for a couple quick slices. They are BIG slices which is awesome. Came out hot with a pretty decent crusty crust. Would definately try a slice if you are looking for some hot pizza.

Some indoor seating with tables or take to-go.

I'm from NYC and this is the worst pizza I've ever had. Rather than slices from jumbo sized pizza pies, they just cut regular sized pizza pies into 4 slices instead of 8. That said, the $6 price is alright given you essentially get 2 slices in 1. However, it tastes horrible. It doesn't even taste cheap. It just tastes wrong. I don't know how to explain it. I'm not trying to sound picky but this was the first time I've thrown out food in years.
This pizza is huge!! I got two slices thinking they would be normal sizes and they had to slice them for me into four! And it was also delicious. I’m definitely coming back!

(updated: Standing in line and watching the counter attendant actively discriminate.) Never saw this behavior again. They have a sign posted at the front ALL are welcome. Best slice in DC for a couple reasons. $5 for basically two slices. But it's also thin crust, flavorful dough, good cheese. It doesn't need much else made this way. I'm glad they got their lives.

Julia, Julia, Julia our bartender was awesome. She was very knowledge of all their options and willingly took the time to assist with choices desired and uncertain of. She explained, in detail, the differences between various items on the menu so that we coukd make the best choice for us overall. May I say that the wings were delicious and still burning the corners of my mouth, lol. The fries were heavy and truly filled you up after a few. The Creme Brule was an awesome choice in doughnut that I appreciate her advising me of it and last but not least that chedder biscuit blew me out of this world. I did not have enough space in me to ingest it all but at least I can rock twice tomorrow. Thankibg Julia for her service. It was awesome and appre oates. A must go while here in DC.

Not worth it. I’ve been dying to come to try the chicken and was sorely disappointed. Waited 40 minutes for bland chicken and a soggy sandwich. Donuts were fine, but not as good as my first try here. Staff was rude. We got there when it was empty, left when it was full. Might be short staffed but doesn’t mean you need to audibly sigh when someone needs to order from you.
Good beer selection but they don't have the complete Atro Donut menu. But great place.

First time here, a bit disappointed. The beer selection was definitely below average for a beer hall. Not crowded, it was easy to find a table to hang out. The 90's alternative rock music was enjoyable - not sure if this music is part of the theme or not. Overall, my experience was just okay.

The service is so bad here, I am stopping in the middle of my meal to write this, so that I might be able to spare another innocent and unknowing soul from coming in here and choking on a cheddar biscuit and their disappointment.
Staff are as pleasant as a bed of nails; food took 45 minutes (for 1 entree, 2 apps and 2 sides) and was mediocre at best.
The bartender and food expeditor were so dismal, another patron actually stopped to ask me, if they were in fact as miserable as he thought. I agreed emphatically and showed him I was in the middle of writing this review.
Spare yourself, your family/friends and tastebuds; but if you don’t like someone, send them here, cause they just might fit right in.
